New Records: Mikel Merino scored in the last minute of extra time to send Spain to the semi-final, marking the first time Spain defeated a tournament host at the tenth attempt.
Toni Kroos played his final game, marking the end of his career.
Key Match Events: Mikel Merino scored the winning goal in the last minute of extra time.
Florian Wirtz scored Germany’s equaliser in the 89th minute.
Dani Olmo assisted the winning goal with a glorious ball into the penalty area.
Niclas Füllkrug had a header that went past the post a minute into added time.
Toni Kroos delivered the final kick of his career, which was caught by Unai Simón.
Dani Carvajal received a red card at the end of the match for hauling down Jamal Musiala.
Unai Simón made a crucial save from Niclas Füllkrug’s diving header in extra time.
Pre-Game Insights: Luis de la Fuente and Julian Nagelsmann emphasized the similarities between the two teams, highlighting their possession and transition play, high press, and counter-press strategies.
Julian Nagelsmann predicted an interesting match due to the teams' styles.
Post-Match Reflections: Spain's players and fans celebrated their advancement to the semi-final.
Germany's players and fans were left heartbroken after the last-minute defeat.
Toni Kroos ended his career with this match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match featured 41 shots and 16 yellow cards, indicating a highly intense and physical game.
The game was described as exhausting and bruising, with players barely able to walk by the end.
The match was held at the Stuttgart Arena.
